## Description {#details}

This class wraps a string in an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a>.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringerror">StringError</a> is useful in cases where the client is not expected to be able to consume the specific error message programmatically (for example, if the error message is to be presented to the user).

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringerror">StringError</a> can also be used when additional information is to be printed along with a error&#95;code message. Depending on the constructor called, this class can either display:
<ul>
<li>the error&#95;code message (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ecerror">ECError</a> behavior)</li>
<li>a string</li>
<li>the error&#95;code message and a string</li>
</ul>


These behaviors are useful when subtyping is required; for example, when a specific library needs an explicit error type. In the example below, PDBError is derived from <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringerror">StringError</a>:


<ProgramListing extension="cpp">

<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">Expected&lt;int&gt; foo() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">   </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9999bd897fc8a1648bd69b36fee2d357">llvm::make&#95;error&lt;PDBError&gt;</a>(pdb&#95;error&#95;code::dia&#95;failed&#95;loading,</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">                                     </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Additional information&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>
